translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Buddha Chapter
Anuruddha Elder’s Birth Story
I, Sumedha, to the Blessed One,
the world’s elder, bull among men;
Dwelling in seclusion,
I saw the world’s leader.
Approaching the Fully Enlightened One,
Sumedha, the world’s leader;
Raising my hands in respectful salutation,
I requested the best of Buddhas.
Out of compassion, great hero,
world’s elder, bull among men;
I will offer you a lamp,

analyzed: rukkha mūlamhi jhāyato  adhivāsesi saḥ dhīraḥ
translated: while you meditate at the foot of a tree.
The wise one, the self-existent one, best of speakers,🔽accepted;
Having split the branches,
I yoked the chariot then.
I offered a thousand wicks
to the Buddha, the world’s protector;
For seven days, having blazed,
my lamps were extinguished.
By that faith in my mind,
and by my intention and aspiration;
Having abandoned the human body,🔽I was reborn in a divine palace.

analyzed: upapannassa devatta  byamham āsi su nimmita
translated: Having been reborn as a god,🔽I was in the delightful Sunimmita realm;
It blazes all around,
this is the fruit of offering lamps.
All around for a hundred leagues,
I said this at that time:
I surpass all the gods,
this is the fruit of the offering of a lamp.
For thirty aeons, Lord of the Gods,
I was King of the Gods;
No one could surpass me,
this is the fruit of the offering of a lamp.
Twenty-eight times I was a Wheel-turning Monarch;
I saw by day and by night,
all around for a league.
With knowledge of a thousand worlds,
I saw in the Teacher’s Dispensation;
I attained the divine eye,
this is the fruit of the offering of a lamp.
The Sambuddha named Sumedha,
for thirty-two thousand aeons;
I gave a lamp to him,
with a mind full of faith.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations,
the six higher knowledges were realised,
the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.”🔽Thus the Elder Anuruddha recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā anuruddho thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Anuruddhattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai anuruddhaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽anuruddha ttherassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Elder Anuruddha’s Chapter is finished.
